issue.title: Joint velocity can not be controlled using SetVelocity()

content.raw:
In rev fc620a7, the joints are controlled using PID controllers on joint angular position, I could not control the velocity using the velocity Controllers. Maybe because the nature of the velocity controlling is more difficult than position controlling and I could not find its correct PID values. 
Finally I could not control the velocity, so I approximated the joints position based on the input effector target velocity and control the position. I don't know if this solution is correct and it needs more test.
In this version the robot only executes the head movements command and simulator keeps the position of the other joints to be zero, 
as a test, in play_on, the simulator sets new arm position for the robot to move down its arms.
content.html: In rev fc620a7, the joints are controlled using PID controllers on joint angular position, I could not control the velocity using the velocity Controllers. Maybe because the nature of the velocity controlling is more difficult than position controlling and I could not find its correct PID values. Finally I could not control the velocity, so I approximated the joints position based on the input effector target velocity and control the position. I don't know if this solution is correct and it needs more test. In this version the robot only executes the head movements command and simulator keeps the position of the other joints to be zero, as a test, in play_on, the simulator sets new arm position for the robot to move down its arms.

issue.title: Joint velocity can not be controlled using SetVelocity()

content.raw: Hi jason, yes definitely, more fixed: rev 1ec5995
content.html: Hi jason, yes definitely, more fixed: rev 1ec5995

issue.title: Joint velocity can not be controlled using SetVelocity()

content.raw:
Hey Nima,

In jliang_model, I have updated Effector.cc so that it checks that numeric values are valid during parsing. For example, "(init (unum lkfjalsdfk) (team left))" would not longer work. Before since we were using atof, parsing non numeric strings would lead to undefined behavior. I changed it so that we are using strtod instead.
content.html:
Hey Nima,

In jliang_model, I have updated Effector.cc so that it checks that numeric values are valid during parsing. For example, "(init (unum lkfjalsdfk) (team left))" would not longer work. Before since we were using atof, parsing non numeric strings would lead to undefined behavior. I changed it so that we are using strtod instead.

issue.title: Joint velocity can not be controlled using SetVelocity()

content.raw: `Joint::SetVelocity` and `Joint::SetPosition` seem to override the physics engine, that is, that value will be set and all other dynamics effects, such as gravity, will be ignored - which is probably not what we want.
content.html: Joint::SetVelocity and Joint::SetPosition seem to override the physics engine, that is, that value will be set and all other dynamics effects, such as gravity, will be ignored - which is probably not what we want.

issue.title: Joint velocity can not be controlled using SetVelocity()

content.raw: As far as I know this is not an issue anymore because we use `JointController::SetPositionTarget()` to control the joints. Reopen if it's not the case.
content.html: As far as I know this is not an issue anymore because we use JointController::SetPositionTarget() to control the joints. Reopen if it's not the case.
